result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Carroll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with huber for work/school/treatment/child care or a combination.  No objection to EMP.  Defendant has 60 days to report to jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called: 8:55 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Michael Cohen;
Date and time set for a Jury Trial.
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Amend Ct. 1 to Ct. 1 (Negligent Operation of a Motor Vehicle-Not Upon a Public Highway) pursuant to 941.01(1).

15TR1320>> DISMISS OUTRIGHT.
15TR1321>> DISMISS OUTRIGHT. 
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Negligent Operation of a Motor Vehicle-Not Upon a Public Highway)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Negligent Operation of a Motor Vehicle-Not Upon a Public Highway)>> 30 Days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment/child care or a combination, No objection to EMP, Court Costs. Court finds 1 Day Credit. Defendant has 60 Days to report to MCJ. DNA Sample does not have to be provided due to date of crime.
